intro: Ophryosporus serratifolius, commonly known as the serrated leaf ophryosporus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
